Medication: Lupus treatment involves antimalarials, corticosteroids, NSAIDs, immunosuppressants, and biologics to manage symptoms and suppress the immune system's overactivity.
Symptom: Lupus symptoms include joint pain, rashes, fatigue, and organ inflammation, with risks of kidney issues, blood clots, and pregnancy complications.
Specialist: Specialists in lupus treatment include rheumatologists, dermatologists, and healthcare providers focused on autoimmune diseases, supported by a team of doctors and physical therapists.
Care: Effective lupus care involves managing symptoms through regular monitoring, stress reduction, sun protection, nutritious diet, adequate sleep, and consistent medical appointments.
